items.question: What is a recovery key/phrase/seed?
items.answer: These terms refer to the string of words provided during the setup of a new crypto wallet. It serves as your lifeline to recover and restore your wallet in case of loss or catastrophe. Remember to write it down!

items.question: How does Stack Wallet make money?
items.answer: Stack Wallet charges a tiny fee for utilizing the built-in exchange with third-party providers. Standard sending and receiving fees go to blockchain miners. Stack Wallet does not make money by selling user data or using ads.

items.question: How does the exchange process work?
items.answer: Stack Wallet partners with third-party exchange providers for seamless exchanges. Simply follow the exchange flow within the app, and the third-party exchange will handle the rest, making it easy for you.

items.question: Do I still need to write down my recovery key if I use Stack Wallet Backup?
items.answer: Yes. While Stack Wallet Backup simplifies the restoration process, writing down your recovery key ensures access to your funds in case of unexpected technical issues.

items.question: How do I restore my wallet?
items.answer: Restoring your wallet is easy. Select 'Add New' on your My Stack page, choose the currency, and opt for 'Restore Wallet.' Enter your preferred name and the complete seed phrase saved for the wallet to see it back in your Stack.
